instructions: Each question maps to behavioral dimensions that influence leadership style (based on well-established frameworks like Lewin's styles, Goleman's emotional intelligence styles, and situational leadership).

questions.text: I prefer to make decisions independently without consulting others.
I regularly seek team input before making final decisions.
I enjoy delegating tasks and trust others to handle them.
I struggle to delegate important responsibilities.
I often tune into my team's emotional state and adjust accordingly.
I give regular, constructive feedback with empathy.
I prioritize results over relationships when needed.
I stay calm and composed during conflict.
I frequently communicate a clear, long-term vision.
I focus more on short-term tasks than strategic goals.
I encourage innovation even when it involves risk.
I prefer tried-and-tested approaches over experimentation.
I actively mentor or coach members of my team.
I design opportunities for others to grow and stretch.
I am energized by helping others realize their potential.
I often find myself solving problems rather than enabling others.
I change my leadership approach based on who I'm working with.
I can influence others even without formal authority.
I adapt quickly when things don't go as planned.
I prefer a structured, consistent leadership routine.
